duties_responsibilities.duty: Coordinate and participate in the design, testing, implementation, and review of complex manual or automated financial and accounting systems.
Prepare monthly balance sheet, income statements, and profit and loss statements.
Maintain a series of financial controls and procedures for the Accounting department.
Provide assistance to outside auditors; gather necessary account information and documents to perform annual audit.
Review internal controls and security of all automated accounting applications to ensure conformity with auditing standards.
Gather and compile information on processes, organizational structure, computer technology, policies, and procedures.
Analyze and review proposals for any system related to financial accounting methods, policies, and procedures; recommend improvements.
Collaborate with appropriate staff to gather input and feedback concerning system needs.
Maintain or assist with maintenance of accounting information systems.
Prepare and deliver comprehensive evaluations, proposals, and recommendations to executive leadership, committees, and other stakeholders.
Assist in the preparation of specifications and technical documentation for new and revised computerized accounting systems.
Perform other duties as assigned by management.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field (Certified Public Accountant preferred)
